intro: Callerya tenasserimensis, commonly known as the Assam flame of the mountain, is a species of flowering plant in the family Fabaceae. It is native to the forests of northeastern India and is characterized by its striking, bright red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is a small to medium-sized shrub or tree, typically reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are alternate, trifoliate, and have a glossy green appearance. The flowers are not only ornamental but also attract various pollinators such as bees and birds.
